intro: Dendrophthora, commonly known as the ghost tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its unique, often gnarled appearance and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. The plant typically grows in temperate regions, particularly in areas with high rainfall and acidic conditions. Its leaves are usually small, leathery, and dark green, while its flowers are bell-shaped and often pink or white. Dendrophthora plays an important ecological role in forest ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
